Green monsters
 




Mike Lowell and Jason Varitek celebrate the catcher's home run.  (AP)



    

    

      
      The big hits just keep on coming for Alex Rodriguez, but it's not enough 
      at Fenway. His two home runs up his total to 12, but the Yankees fall 7-6 to the surging BoSox. Even so, life is wonderful for A-Rod, Scott Miller says.
    

  
 Related Links:• Posada leaves game | Doyel: Bronx bummers | Freeman: 'Massholes'• Rankings | Fantasy | Rumors | Miller: Insider | Letters | Pennings | Hey!


 


 

 





 Miami twice? Too daunting of a task for the champs


    

      
      The Heat get their worst-case scenario when banged-up Dwyane Wade faces 
      the physical Bulls, starting Saturday. But Tony Mejia still calls 
      for a repeat ... of the 
      '05 Finals.
    

  
• SAT | SUN | Series: East | West | Mail |  Mejia


 

 





 Parrish: Looking for the right school? Just wait a bit ...


    

      Only fools rush in -- and Jai Lucas  
      and Patrick Patterson are no fools. By waiting to sign 
      letters of intent, they've grabbed headlines and sweet offers. 
      Ingenious, right?
